com.onwbp.adaptation
Class Request

java.lang.Object
  com.onwbp.adaptation.Request

public final class Request
extends Object

Defines a specific request on a table.

A request is executed by calling the method execute().

Multi-threading

An instance of this class does not block access from multiple concurrent threads.

Performance

See Setting a fetch size on optimization with respect to the expected size of the RequestResult and the limitations when using PostgreSQL as the underlying database.

See Also:
AdaptationTable.createRequest()

Method Detail

isIncludeOcculting

public boolean isIncludeOcculting()
See Also:
setIncludeOcculting(boolean)

setIncludeOcculting

public void setIncludeOcculting(boolean includeOcculting)
If the argument is true, this method specifies that the request result will include records in occulting mode.

If the argument is false, records in occulting mode are not included in the result. If the property is not set, it is considered to be false.

getLocale

public Locale getLocale()
See Also:
setLocale(Locale)

setLocale

public void setLocale(Locale aLocale)
Set a locale to the request. It may be needed if the request filter is locale-dependent, i.e. a predicate filter of the form osd:label(./localized_field)='A'.

setSession

public void setSession(Session aSession)
Set the session on the request. Set also permission rules on the resulting records and the session locale.

See Also:
setLocale(Locale)

getSortCriteria

public RequestSortCriteria getSortCriteria()
See Also:
setSortCriteria(RequestSortCriteria)

setOrderByPrimaryKey

public void setOrderByPrimaryKey()
Specifies that the request result will be sorted by primary key in ascending order.

See Also:
setSortCriteria(RequestSortCriteria)

setSortCriteria

public void setSortCriteria(RequestSortCriteria aSortCriteria)
Specifies that the request result will be sorted according to the specified criteria.

If this method is not called, the default sort order is undefined, in which case the results will be sorted according to the order of whichever index is selected for computing the request. If no filter is specified, the result will be ordered according to the primary key fields (ascending).

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the specified sort is not consistent with the table structure.
See Also:
setOrderByPrimaryKey(), AdaptationTable.createRequestResult(String, RequestSortCriteria)

getSpecificFilter

public AdaptationFilter getSpecificFilter()
See Also:
setSpecificFilter(AdaptationFilter)

setSpecificFilter

public void setSpecificFilter(AdaptationFilter aFilter)
Specifies that the request result will only include the records that satisfy the filter passed as an argument.

If not set, the value of this property is null, and no specific filtering will be performed.

setXPathFilter

public void setXPathFilter(String predicateExpression)
Specifies that the request result will only include the records which satisfy the predicate passed as an argument.

If a filter has been specified by means of method setSpecificFilter(AdaptationFilter), it is replaced by a filter that implements the predicate.

See Also:
AdaptationTable.selectOccurrences(String), setSpecificFilter(AdaptationFilter), XPathExpressionHelper, XPath supported syntax.

getFetchSize

public int getFetchSize()
See Also:
setFetchSize(int)

setFetchSize

public void setFetchSize(int rows)
Provides a hint to the underlying database as to the number of records to fetch at a time from the result of executing this request. If the fetch size specified is '0', the underlying implementation determines the fetch size independently.

See Setting a fetch size for the limitations when using PostgreSQL as the underlying database.

Parameters:
rows - the number of rows to fetch
See Also:
Statement.setFetchSize(int)

execute

public RequestResult execute()
                      throws IncompatibleChangeError
Executes the request and returns the result.

Throws:
IncompatibleChangeError

public String toString()
